title: EA to CEO, Private Equity
description:
A highly experienced Private/Business EA is required to support an UHNW founder, for this global Private Equity fund, in an all encompassing EA role managing business and personal elements of their life. Working a part of a senior team, you will be responsible lifestyle management, projects and business scheduling.
This is a role requiring 24/7 availability, 5 days in office and a dedicated, proactive approach.

With no two days the same and huge variety, you will be someone who thrives on the challenge of responding to the requirements of a hugely demanding international office and personal life. You will enjoy operating in a demanding private PA role, embracing a challenge and take pride in delivering results, while also being able to fulfil the more structured corporate tasks in the business capacity. Working as part of a team within the CEO's office is also essential. Communication skills and problem solving are essential skills.

You should also be available 24/7 evenings and weekends, to support in a full capacity.

Experience required: please review before applying:
Salary circa ¬£90-100K+
Experience of supporting an UHNW individual as a Private PA is essential, with additional CEO level experience with an international remit, is essential. Applications made without this experience will not be considered.
Strong academics
Excellent communication skills; able to naturally function with VIP, UHNWIs and their liaison points and the ability to work well in a team.
You should have a calm demeanour, be extremely well organised, intuitive, proactive and bring a positive, upbeat personality.
industries: Venture Capital and Private Equity Principals

title: Executive Assistant
description:
Executive Assistant - Global Financial Services

Join a globally respected financial services firm known not just for its high performance, but for its incredible culture and show-stopping offices. We‚Äôre on the lookout for a Executive Assistant to support a high-calibre team, including Senior Managing Directors and VPs‚Äîpeople at the top of their game.

This is more than just a traditional EA role. You‚Äôll be a key player, helping to keep the gears moving smoothly in a fast-paced, high-stakes environment, where your expertise is respected and your contributions truly matter.

What You‚Äôll Be Doing:
Seamlessly support a dynamic team of senior leaders.
Manage highly complex calendars and juggle competing priorities.
Organise detailed global travel itineraries with precision.
Act as a trusted point of contact internally and externally.
Help nurture an inclusive, energising team culture.

What We're Looking For:
Solid experience as an Executive Assistant‚Äîfinancial services experience is highly desired.
High level ability to manage schedules and travel across time zones.
A curious, solution-focused mindset‚Äîyou‚Äôre always one step ahead.
Next-level organisation and multitasking skills.
Strong emotional intelligence and top-tier communication skills.

Why You‚Äôll Love It Here:
A collaborative, respectful, and people-first culture‚Äîyou‚Äôll feel valued from day one.
Career growth and learning opportunities that will keep you challenged and inspired.
Hybrid flexibility (3 days in-office, 2 remote).
A competitive salary + benefits package that recognises your worth.
industries: Financial Services, Investment Banking, and Venture Capital and Private Equity Principals

title: Commercial Finance Analyst
description:
Freshminds has partnered with a leading entertainment brand looking to hire an Investment and Property Business Partner to drive key strategic initiatives within its investment & property people and technology functions.

Working closely with senior management and reporting to the Director of Commercial Finance, you‚Äôll provide data-driven insights to enhance decision-making, assess capital investments, and track the performance of new sites, technology, and workforce initiatives.

What you‚Äôll be doing:
Managing investment cases for property, new sites, and technology.
Developing reports and analysis to support investment and capital planning.
Identifying trends, risks, and opportunities using advanced analytics.

Requirements:
Strong data and analytical skills (SQL, Advanced Excel, Power BI with Python/Amazon RDS desirable).
Experience in investment, property, or multi-site businesses.
Proven consulting skill-set.
Ability to translate complex challenges into actionable insights.

title: Business Analyst
description:
Business Analyst ‚Äì TOM, Business Readiness, Operations, Process, Compliance, Regulatory - Northampton ‚Äì ¬£65,000 - ¬£75,000 base + Bonus & Benefits

My client, a leading Financial Services organisation based in Northampton, are currently looking for a Business Analysts to join their new programme on a permanent basis.

You will be working directly with the Head Of to define the TOM across a new operations team being set up, in response to a Compliance mandate that will work across multiple business units in the bank. Further to this you will be running the analysis and providing the vision on the team set up, and how it will support the technology changes to follow, and defining the target operating model as this programme moves into BAU.
The ideal candidate will have a strong process delivery background with experience setting up new operations teams / functions with an appreciation for how technology is impacted and delivered.

If you have experience in any of the below, please apply:
Proven experience as a Business Analyst (preferably large scale Organisation or Financial Services)
Proven Target Operating Model (TOM) delivery
A good background in business readiness / operations would be helpful
Solid core business analysis skills, working from inception through to delivery
Excellent stakeholder management
Experience delivering to tight regulatory deadlines

This is an excellent opportunity for someone to join a new programme of work, that will cut across multiple business units within the bank.

title: Data Analyst
description:
Data Analyst
***MUST HAVE MARITIME EXPERIENCE***

We're looking for a skilled Data Analyst to turn complex data into clear insights that drive business performance. If you're passionate about data storytelling, automation, and impact, this is the role for you.

Responsibilities:
Extract, validate, and analyze large data sets for trends and insights
Build dashboards and reports (Power BI, Excel) to support decision-making
Collaborate with stakeholders to define data requirements
Audit data quality and ensure integrity across sources
Automate recurring reports and improve analytics workflows

What we‚Äôre looking for:
6+ years of experience in data analytics
Advanced Excel (VBA, Macros), Power BI, SQL, PowerPoint
Strong statistical and analytical mindset
Bachelor‚Äôs/Master‚Äôs in Mathematics, Statistics, or related field
Bonus: Experience with automation tools and data audit processes

title: Senior Brand Designer
description:
At OWL, we connect exceptional talent with brands and agencies that want to make meaningful creative impact. On behalf of a bold and forward-thinking client, we‚Äôre looking for a Senior Brand Designer who doesn‚Äôt just think outside the box‚Äîbut redefines what the box even is.
This role is about more than delivering beautiful work. It‚Äôs about reshaping how audiences experience brands‚Äîthrough immersive, boundary-pushing design that inspires, connects, and resonates.

The Opportunity

As Senior Designer, you‚Äôll lead the charge on transformative creative, working closely with multidisciplinary teams to bring big, brave ideas to life. From concept to execution, across print, motion, 3D and beyond, you‚Äôll craft experiences that go deeper than visuals‚Äîtelling stories that move people.

What You'll Be Doing

Collaborating with writers, strategists, and account teams to build bold, integrated ideas that answer real human needs.
Creating across media‚Äîfrom traditional formats to motion and experiential‚Äîwith a focus on multidimensional storytelling.
Turning ideas into reality with a deep understanding of craft, production, and detail.
Commissioning and collaborating with illustrators, photographers, filmmakers and other creative partners.
Contributing to and creating storyboards, animations, and filmic assets.
Mentoring junior designers and nurturing future talent.
Presenting your vision with confidence‚Äîinternally and client-side‚Äîwith clarity, passion, and purpose.
Working closely with project teams to ensure deadlines and deliverables are met without compromising creativity.
Holding every piece of work to the highest standards of design excellence and strategic intent.

Who You Are

A creative leader with a sharp eye, strong ideas, and an even stronger drive to push them further.
A storyteller who knows that powerful design starts with empathy, insight, and clear purpose.
A perfectionist (in the best way) with meticulous attention to detail and craft.
A natural collaborator and self-starter who thrives in fast-paced, ideas-first environments.
Someone who‚Äôs culturally curious and constantly feeding your creative mind with fresh perspectives.

What‚Äôs in it for You

A platform to stretch your creative wings‚Äîacross film, experiential, retail, and other evolving disciplines.
A stream of diverse, exciting projects that challenge conventions and keep things fresh.
A values-led culture: inclusive, open, collaborative, and genuinely fun.
The chance to mentor rising talent, shape creative thinking, and leave a lasting mark‚Äîboth inside the studio and out in the world.

The Culture You'll Be Joining

This is a team that leads with authenticity, depth, and purpose. Their values?
Realness: Clear, actionable ideas grounded in truth‚Äînever fluff.
Rigour: A relentless pursuit of excellence and originality.
Empathy: Listening first, collaborating with heart, and designing with people in mind.

title: Full Stack Engineer
description:
üè¢: Full Stack Engineer (backend leaning).
üìçRemote First (UK) with an office in Central London.
üí∞: ¬£45,000 - ¬£75,000

This is a unique opportunity to join a growing company aiming to revolutionise the way we do our finances. With a lean, agile team of 10 Full Stack Engineers, you‚Äôll be working in an exciting environment, directly contributing to the company‚Äôs success.

About the Role.
We‚Äôre looking for a Full Stack Engineer to help design, develop, and scale our FinTech platform. This role leans heavily towards backend development, where you'll be responsible for building and optimising the core services and APIs that drive our system. You‚Äôll work on ensuring high performance, scalability, and seamless integration across our microservices architecture.

What You‚Äôll Do:
üîπBuild and enhance backend services and APIs using Node.js and TypeScript.
üîπDesign and maintain a microservices architecture that ensures resilience and scalability.
üîπUtilise AWS and serverless technologies to streamline infrastructure and deployment processes.
üîπWrite high-quality, maintainable code following best practices for security and performance.

Tech Stack:
üîπBackend: Node.js, TypeScript
üîπFrontend: React.js
üîπInfrastructure: AWS Lambda, Serverless Computing
üîπArchitecture: Microservices

What We‚Äôre Looking For? üëÄ
üîπHands-on experience as a Full Stack Engineer or in a similar role.
üîπStrong proficiency in Node.js, React.js, and TypeScript.
üîπKnowledge of cloud platforms (AWS) and serverless technologies.
üîπExperience with microservices architecture and building scalable systems.

Why Join Us? ‚ÜòÔ∏è
üîπWork with a modern tech stack and help reshape financial processes.
üîπGain hands-on experience in an innovative environment.
üîπGrow professionally with opportunities for learning and development.

title: Chief Operating Officer
description:
Who we are

Leading e-commerce Corporate Services Group
Services include: Company Formation, Address Services, Call Answering and Managed Live Chat, Company Secretarial, Law Practice, Serviced Offices
Customer base - 500,000
Covent Garden-based
Founder/owner CEO
Profitable and growing at 20% per annum


üöÄ Ready to Be the Operational Powerhouse Behind the UK‚Äôs Next E-Commerce Giant?

Do you thrive in high-growth environments? Are you obsessed with performance, scalability, and operational excellence? Do you have the leadership experience to drive performance from our Operations Team and customer-facing teams in a fast-paced environment?
If you're not just experienced‚Äîbut exceptional‚Äîat managing scaling e-commerce operations, this might be the biggest leadership opportunity of your career.


üëä Who Are We?

We‚Äôre a fast-growing e-commerce Group with a portfolio of category-defining brands. We‚Äôve built something special‚Äîand we‚Äôre setting up to scale fast. We‚Äôre on the hunt for a strategic and hands-on execution-focused COO to help us lead from the front, build robust systems, and drive sustainable growth.


üéØ What You‚Äôll Be Doing:

As COO, you‚Äôll be the driving force behind our day-to-day operations, aligning our teams, systems, and strategy to deliver best-in-class performance. This isn‚Äôt about maintaining the status quo‚Äîit‚Äôs about building what‚Äôs next.

Develop and execute scalable operational strategies across all brands and functions
Partner with the leadership team to shape long-term vision and business goals
Optimise Compliance, order fulfilment and customer service to improve efficiency and retention
Drive cross-departmental alignment, setting KPIs and tracking success across key business units
Build a world-class team culture rooted in performance, accountability, and speed
Identify new tools, partners, and platforms to improve margins and scalability


üí• What‚Äôs In It for You?

A pivotal leadership role in one of the UK‚Äôs most exciting e-commerce ventures
Real authority, real ownership, with the ability to lead teams of people
Direct impact on the trajectory of multiple fast-scaling brands
A high-performance team that moves fast and builds bold


üî• We Want to Hear from You If You Are:

A proven senior operations professional with experience of both granular and strategic operations.
Experienced leading and scaling teams in high-growth customer-facing environments
Data-obsessed, process-oriented, and laser-focused on results
Comfortable owning customer ops, compliance and commercial outcomes
A strong leader who inspires trust, sets a high bar, and delivers
A strategic thinker who is also happy to get into the weeds and get things done

Salary: ¬£120,000 to ¬£140,000
Working hours: 37.5 hours per week, 09:00 to 17:30, Monday to Friday
Location: Office-based, Covent Garden

title: Global Procurement Manager
description:
Title: Global Procurement Manager
Sector: FMCG / Manufacturing
Location: Remote with occasional travel to UK & Europe offices and sites

Salary & Package: ¬£75,000 - ¬£80,000 + an additional strong benefits package

Sea Global are delighted to be partnering with a globally renowned leader in the FMCG sector, who are currently looking to appoint 2x Global Procurement Managers to join their team. They are a FTSE 100 consumer goods company who are transforming their procurement function and have ambitious plans for the future.

Global Procurement Manager - Facilities Management
Global Procurement Manager - Marketing

They are looking for Procurement professionals with expertise across Facilities Management e.g. Hard (Engineering, Maintenance) and Soft (Security, Cleaning, Catering)

For the other role they are looking for Procurement professionals with expertise in the Marketing category e.g. Creative Agencies, Advertising, Trade Marketing, Point of Sale (POS), Brand, Digital, Media, PR, Market Research.

The role reports directly into the Global Head of Indirect Procurement and sits within the wider procurement function where you will be responsible for managing the relevant category. They are ideally looking for someone with FMCG or similar industry experience who can hit the ground running from day one.

They are looking for someone to come in on a 12-month FTC with the option to go permanent. Please see below and reach out for more information!

Role & Responsibilities
Develop and implement strategic sourcing strategies across the relevant category.
Responsible for leading end-to-end procurement including Tenders, Negotiation, Supplier Relationship Management, Contract Management, and Spend Data Analysis.
Build relationships with local and international suppliers, negotiating and ensuring deals align with business activities.
Oversee the relevant category spend, strategic sourcing, and supplier negotiations.

Experience & Requirements
Strong understanding of procurement, category management, or strategic sourcing.
Comfortable working in a fast paced market, demonstrating excellent supplier and stakeholder management skills.
Demonstrated ability to lead the Facilities Management or Marketing category.
Ideally degree and/or MCIPS qualified

title: Project Manager
description:
Project Manager ‚Äì Digital, Software, Payments, Regulatory, Agile, Change Management, Technology, Strategy, Stakeholder Management, Financial Services - Northampton - Permanent - ¬£50,000- ¬£65,000 Base + Bonus + Benefits

My client, a leading Financial Services organisation have a key permanent requirement for a number of Project Managers to join a critical regulatory programme of work in their Northampton based office.

The ideal candidate will have a solid technical background / understanding coupled with strong, broad end to end Project Management experience. This role will be supporting a number of high profile technical programme of change in the Digital and Payments space, as well as a time critical FCA regulated programme with a specific focus on the delivery of various improvements within their existing digital and payments platform.

You will need strong Project Management delivery experience in both agile and waterfall environments and will need to be comfortable facing off to senior stakeholders across the organisation. These are key projects of work that need mobilising, in which you will be in charge of complex teams and ¬£multi-million project budgets as well as managing change within delivery, planning, risks and issues, ensuring delivery in line with the business‚Äôs requirements. My client are keen on speaking with individuals who have end to end project experience with a delivery focused mindset, who can anticipate change in a large organisation.


The be successful in this role you will need;
Proven Project Manager, preferably within a large-scale organisation / Financial Services
Regulatory experience would be highly beneficial
Excellent stakeholder management
Proven experience managing multiple project work streams
Strong experience managing and implementing change projects
Regulatory project experience would be highly beneficial
Agile and waterfall methodology exposure
Strong experience of writing and translating both business and functional specifications
Extensive stakeholder management skills

This is an excellent opportunity for someone to join an expanding and exciting team in what is a highly visible area at the moment, with multiple on-going projects.

title: Project Manager
description:
Project Manager
¬£60,000 - 75,000
Hybrid, flexible working

We are partnered with a high-growth SaaS organisation in the Energy sector who are growing their in-house consulting/project delivery team.

The Project Manager will be responsible for managing the end-to-end delivery of your assigned project from start-up, through to execution and close-down, to the required standard of quality and within specified constraints of time and costs.

Responsibilities include:
Full project lifecycle ownership, from inception to deployment and handover to BAU support
Client leadership through the project, providing expert guidance, advice and negotiation where required
Cost estimating and budget management
Construction of detailed work plans coupled with activity and resource planning
Communication of progress across all key internal and external stakeholders
Working with wider teams to deliver projects creatively and analytically in a problem-solving environment

What we are looking for:
Knowledge of the Energy sector
Experience in managing and coordinating complex projects from inception to completion ‚Äì delivering to time, quality and budget
Experience of delivering Agile SaaS projects
Experience of delivering tech-lead transformation projects is essential
Entrepreneurial mind-set and a good problem-solver, with a structured approach to formulate the best outcome
Happy being hands-on, working in an environment with changing priorities and deadlines
Commercially-minded

Logistics:
At least 3 days working from home a week
A few days a month in Windsor
A few days a month in Nottingham

Benefits include pay reviews annually linked to performance, discretionary bonus, private healthcare, and gym membership.

------

Regretfully, due to a high volume of applicants, we are only able to reply to those who are successful.

Equal Opportunities:

We are committed to promoting equality of opportunity for all employees and job applicants. In line with the Equality Act 2010, we strive to create and maintain a working environment in which everyone is able to make the best use of their skills, free from discrimination or harassment, and in which all decisions are based on merit. No person is subjected to any less favourable treatment on any discriminatory grounds on the basis of age, disability, gender reassignment, marital or civil partner status, pregnancy and maternity, race, colour, nationality, ethnic or national origin, religion or belief, sex or sexual orientation.

title: Information Technology Auditor
description:
Location: Edinburgh

Lutine Bell are supporting a leading global financial service organisation to appoint an IT Auditor into their Edinburgh office.

title: Project Manager
description:
Senior Architect
Location: Central London (Hybrid working)
Salary: ¬£60,000 - ¬£65,000 per annum
*Permanent*

The Role
A prestigious multi-disciplinary design studio in Central London is seeking a Senior Project Manager to join their growing team. Known for delivering exceptional high-end residential and luxury hospitality projects across the UK and internationally, the studio offers a full turnkey service from architecture and interior design through to project management.
You‚Äôll play a key role in managing complex, design-led projects from pre-construction through to handover - working closely with internal teams, consultants, contractors, and clients to ensure seamless delivery. Reporting to the Head of Project Management, this role is ideal for someone with a background in architecture or a construction-related field and a passion for premium design.

Requirements
5+ years of project management experience in the UK
Track record of delivering high-end residential, commercial, or hospitality projects
Familiarity with projects ranging from ¬£1m to ¬£15m in value
Understanding of bespoke detailing and luxury finishes

Strong understanding of UK building regulations, construction methods, and planning policy
Organised, proactive, and detail-oriented with a collaborative mindset

Benefits

Collaborative, supportive studio culture with scope for progression
Hybrid working arrangements
Pet friendly office
Competitive salary

Interested in learning more or ready to apply? Email your CV to fran@bemoreurban.com

title: Senior National Account Manager
description:
A masstige beauty brand is looking for an experienced Senior National Account Manager to be based in London. This is a 12 month maternity cover role starting at the end of May.

As Senior National Account Manager, you are responsible for contributing towards the development of one of the client‚Äôs three key pillar brand strategies focusing on a leading retailer, Boots UK. You will act as the key contact for all negotiation, commercial discussion and strategy with the retailer.

An overview of your key responsibilities:
To autonomously drive the UK growth of the brand within the leading retailer
Build upon the brand‚Äôs rapid growth in the retailer, maintaining sustainable profitability model
Management of gross margin, COGS blend, investment and local market strategies balancing the overall P&L for your account
To budget, forecast and manage the line level and account level requirement
Influence both brand retailer initiatives, to creatively deliver a growth strategy, building upon collaborative relationships, both new and established
Be the eyes and ears of the brand within the retailer, listening to feedback, reporting the strategies of the retailers back to the brand
Build credible and collaborative relationships with all levels of the retail partner
Be the driver of cross functional relationships internally and ensuring the strategic needs of the retailer business and its growth plan are met by the business
Working closely with Finance to ensure business accounting is accurate

Our ideal candidate has experience working at Boots UK, such as a current Boots employee looking for a promotion, a category manager, an assistant buyer or a candidate who has relationships at Boots.

You should be proficient in Microsoft Office and possess a relevant degree or equivalent. You possess advanced numerical and literacy skills, enabling you to translate data into actionable insights that drive positive change. Your excellent communication abilities ensure clear and compelling presentations. Extensive beauty industry knowledge is further complemented by your keen market awareness and consumer trend interpretation skills.

Your track record of progression and a mix of experience in both large and small companies, particularly within skincare, demonstrates a commitment to growth. Finally, your excellent communication skills, collaborative spirit, strong work ethic, and entrepreneurial drive position you for success.
industries: Retail Luxury Goods and Jewelry and Retail

title: Head of Procurement
description:

Provide high quality analysis and market intelligence of Procurement activities to inform strategic direction
Sourcing and risk identification in every area of the process

Food Procurement (ideally Restaurant/QSR/Casual Dining)
Led and managed procurement teams (small teams count)
End to end procurement

¬£75,000 - ¬£85,000

title: Financial Controller
description:
Job Title: Financial Controller - Insurance
Location: Watford
Salary: ¬£90,000 - ¬£100,000 plus Travel Allowance
Benefits: Bonus, Excellent Pension Contribution, Excellent Pension, Private Medical, 26 Days Holiday
Hybrid Working: 2-3 days per week in the office

We are seeking an accomplished finance leader with expertise in the insurance sector to join our client as a Financial Controller. This is a highly hands-on and operational role, requiring someone who is comfortable rolling up their sleeves while overseeing all aspects of financial reporting and operations. The successful candidate will ensure compliance with regulatory standards while driving efficiencies across the business.

Key Responsibilities:

Financial Reporting & Compliance:
Lead the preparation of statutory accounts and audit files.
Manage regulatory filings and company secretarial duties.
Ensure compliance with local and international accounting standards, liaising with external auditors as required.

Taxation:
Oversee IPT, VAT, and Corporate Tax obligations.
Review and prepare tax returns, ensuring timely and accurate submissions.

Treasury Management:
Maintain strong relationships with banking partners.
Manage bank mandates and approval processes.
Develop and monitor monthly cash forecasts to optimise liquidity.

Group Reporting:
Coordinate quarterly group consolidation activities.
Work closely with regional and head office finance teams to meet group reporting timelines.

Regulatory Compliance:
Prepare bi-annual and year-end submissions to regulatory bodies.
Contribute to annual reports and ensure ongoing compliance with industry regulations.

Finance Operations:
Oversee the finance team‚Äôs day-to-day operations, including outsourced activities.
Drive efficiency through the adoption of best practices and the implementation of new accounting standards.

About You:

Experience:
10+ years of progressive finance experience, ideally within the insurance industry.
Leadership:
Proven ability to lead and inspire teams, balancing hands-on involvement with strategic oversight.

Technical Expertise:
Fully qualified accountant (ACA or ACCA) with a deep understanding of accounting principles and IFRS standards.
Experience with accounting systems such as SAP is advantageous.

Strategic Focus:
Skilled at prioritising resources to achieve strategic goals and delivering process improvements.

Communication:
Strong interpersonal skills with the ability to influence stakeholders at all levels.
Adaptability:
Energetic and proactive, with a results-driven approach and a commitment to continuous improvement.

IT Skills:
Advanced Excel skills are essential.

This is an exciting opportunity for an experienced finance professional to step into a leadership role within a forward-thinking organisation. If you are ready to make a lasting impact, apply now!

title: Business Analyst
description:
Business Analyst - (Insurance)

title: Corporate Credit Analyst
description:

Level: AVP
Primary Coverage: Natural Resources - Oil, Gas, Commodity Traders
Job Type: Permanent
Location: London, Hybrid Working
Relevant Experience: Must have Investment Banking / Corporate Banking Experience

We are currently working with a leading global financial institution to recruit an Assistant Vice President (AVP) - Credit Risk Management for their Corporate Credit Risk Team in London. This is a second line of defence role, offering the opportunity to play a critical part in managing and mitigating credit risks across EMEA.

Our client is looking for a proactive and analytical professional to provide oversight and detailed analysis of corporate credit transactions, ensuring robust risk management practices and supporting sustainable growth.

Key Responsibilities
Credit Analysis: Conduct structured reviews of Front Office credit applications, identifying and articulating risk issues and mitigations.
Risk Appetite Communication: Clearly communicate the Credit Department‚Äôs risk perception and appetite for transactions, ensuring alignment with bank policies and procedures.
Front Office Collaboration: Act as a trusted partner to Front Office deal teams, providing constructive challenge on risk issues while supporting timely client delivery.
Portfolio Management: Ensure accurate obligor grading and forward-looking risk assessments within your assigned portfolio.
Emerging Risk Monitoring: Proactively monitor and address emerging credit risks in collaboration with Front Office and other risk functions.
Special Credits Oversight: Review Self-Assessment submissions and credit cost provisioning for Special Credits.

Your Background
Qualifications: Degree-level education and/or relevant professional qualifications (e.g., ACA, ACCA, ACT, CFA).
Experience: Some experience in a credit management role (1st or 2nd line), with strong corporate credit analysis skills.
Technical Knowledge: Familiarity with corporate loan products, trade finance products, and derivative products, including relevant documentation.

Skills:
Exceptional written and verbal communication skills, with the ability to prepare clear and concise credit papers.
Strong interpersonal skills, with a collaborative approach to teamwork.
High level of IT literacy and proficiency in risk management tools.

Hybrid Working: Enjoy the flexibility of hybrid working, balancing office collaboration with remote productivity.
Career Growth: Be part of a dynamic and supportive team, with opportunities for professional development and career progression.
Impactful Work: Play a key role in shaping the bank‚Äôs credit risk strategy and ensuring sustainable growth.
